clinical_study.brief_title: An Intervention Study to Evaluate a Website Tailored to New Dads to Promote Mental Health
clinical_study.official_title: HealthyDads.Ca-Development and Pilot Evaluation of a Multimodal E-Health Intervention to Promote the Mental Health of Men at Risk for Depression

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to develop and pilot test HealthyDads.ca, a website for expectant first-time fathers who have known risk factors for depression.

primary_outcome.measure: Acceptability of HealthyDads.caHealthyDads.ca measured by the Usability and Satisfaction questionnaire
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the acceptability of the internet delivered program in terms of rating on items pertaining to the website's ease of use and satisfaction.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on depressed mood as measured by the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (EPDS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Study entry, 6 weeks post randomization, 2 and 6 months following delivery
primary_outcome.description: This is a widely used reliable and standardized measure of depression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline on emotional well-being as measured by the Mental Health Continuum-Short Form (MHC-SF)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Study entry, 6 weeks post randomization, 2 and 6 months following delivery
secondary_outcome.description: This is a widely used reliable and standardized measure of psychological well-being.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline on parenting stress measured by the Parenting Stress Scale (PARSS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Study entry, 6 weeks post randomization, 2 and 6 months following delivery
secondary_outcome.description: This is a widely used reliable and standardized measure of parenting stress.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline on level of physical activity participation measured by the International Physical Activity Questionnaire (IPAQ)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Study entry, 6 weeks post randomization, 2 and 6 months following delivery
secondary_outcome.description: This is a widely used reliable and standardized measure of physical activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline on sleep quality measured by the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Study entry, 6 weeks post randomization, 2 and 6 months following delivery
secondary_outcome.description: This is a widely used reliable and standardized of sleep quality.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline on perceptions of stigma measured with the Stigma Scale for Receiving Psychological Help (SSRPH),
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Study entry, 6 weeks post randomization, 2 and 6 months following delivery
secondary_outcome.description: This is a reliable and standardized measure of stigma perceptions associated with with seeking help for mental health issues.

clinical_study.condition: Mental Health in Expectant First-time Fathers

arm_group.description: An on-line self-help psychoeducational website tailored to new dads. Psychoeducational learning modules and tools, including a 6 week physical activity challenge..
No access to the intervention. Will complete the same questionnaires as the Healthydads.ca group over the study period.

intervention.description: Psychoeducational learning modules and tools. Men will choose modules based on interest and need.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Able to communicate in French or English
- Either married or cohabiting at the time of study entry
- First child for both partners
- Have internet access
- Score <12 on the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (EPDS)
- Not currently receiving psychotherapy from a health professional or on medication for a mental disorder
- At least 1 risk factor for depression if they score < 6 on the EPDS: a)history of depression, b) elevated anxiety or c) couple discord
Exclusion Criteria:
- Suicidal ideation or intent
- Physical condition precluding participation in exercise
